title: Learning Go as a React Developer
description: Introduction to Go lang and my journey to Web development.

body.raw:
<Callout>
 Why have I started learning GO, even if I am a frontend engineer?
 When I started working as a frontend engineer, it was so overwhelming to learn all the technologies used in web development. Sometimes I would get lost in information overload.
 After one big sigh, I told myself "everybody started little and became an experts". So I started learning new things small by small.

 Lets see what we can know about Go.
 
</Callout>


# An Introduction to Go Programming Language for React Developers

As a React developer, you're probably familiar with JavaScript and its ecosystem of libraries and tools. While JavaScript is a great language for building client-side applications, it's not always the best choice for building server-side applications that need to handle a large volume of requests and data. This is where Go comes in.

Go is a powerful and efficient programming language that is designed to be fast and scalable, making it a great choice for building backend systems and microservices. Here are some of the key features of Go that make it a great choice for React developers:

## Performance

One of the main benefits of Go is its performance. Go is a compiled language, which means that it is optimized for speed and efficiency. This makes Go a great choice for building high-performance backend systems and APIs that need to handle a large volume of requests and data.

## Concurrency

Go is designed to support concurrency, which means that it can handle multiple tasks and requests at the same time. This makes it easy to build systems that can scale to handle a large number of users and requests. Go achieves concurrency through its support for goroutines and channels, which allow for easy and efficient communication between different parts of the program.

## Ease of Use

Go has a simple and easy-to-learn syntax, which makes it a great choice for developers who are new to the language. Go's syntax is similar to C, which should be familiar to most developers. In addition, Go has a growing community of developers and resources, which makes it easy to get started with the language.

## Cross-platform Support

Go is designed to be cross-platform, which means that it can run on a wide range of operating systems and platforms. This makes it easy to build applications that can run on multiple platforms, without the need for additional development or customization.

## Getting Started

To get started with Go, you'll need to download and install the Go compiler on your computer. You can download the latest version of the compiler from the official Go website (https://golang.org/). Once you've installed the compiler, you can start writing Go programs using your favorite text editor or integrated development environment (IDE).

Here's a simple "Hello, World!" program in Go:


```go
package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
    fmt.Println("Hello, World!")
}
```


In this program, we import the "fmt" package to use the Println() function, which prints the message "Hello, World!" to the console. We then define a main() function, which is the entry point for the program. When we run the program, the output will be "Hello, World!".

## Conclusion

As a React developer, Go is a great language to consider if you're looking to build backend systems and APIs that need to handle a large volume of requests and data. With its support for performance, concurrency, ease of use, and cross-platform support, Go is a powerful and efficient language that can help you build scalable and reliable systems.

title: Is concierge service coming to booking platforms as AI assistants?
description: Recent boom on AI tools like ChatGPT makes your wonder if travel industry is going to change. Here are my thoughts on this subject.

body.raw:
<Callout>
  This is exclusively my personal thoughts on the subject matter.
  **I am keen to any hear any comments and thoughts.**

</Callout>

---
My thoughts on how trip booking platforms search functionality will change with emerging Open AI APIs.
---

As more people turn to online platforms for their travel needs, trip booking platforms are looking for ways to provide a more personalized and intuitive experience for their users. One way that platforms can achieve this is by incorporating chat functions into their user interface.

Chat functions allow users to interact with the platform in a conversational manner, rather than simply entering keywords or phrases. This can help users find what they're looking for more quickly and efficiently, while also providing a more personalized and engaging experience.

This is a lot like Hotel concierge service, where guests are able to ask for directions, tips, bookings of restaurants and attractions to make their travel experience more pleasant. I always felt like concierge service is like a **"cheat code"**, which gives you such advantages sometimes.
Perhaps this service is already being used by other booking platforms. However, travel industry is such a delicate business with privacy issues and personal tailored preferences. Therefore, I understand this model might take some time and thoughts into consideration.

Here are some ways that chat functions can enhance the user interface of a trip booking platform:

1. Natural language processing: By incorporating natural language processing (NLP) technology, chat functions can understand and respond to user queries in a more human-like manner. This can make it easier for users to find what they're looking for, even if they're not familiar with the specific terminology used in the travel industry.

2. Personalization: Chat functions can be programmed to provide personalized recommendations based on a user's search history and preferences. For example, if a user frequently books luxury hotels, the chat function can provide recommendations that match their preferences.

3. Integration with search and booking tools: Chat functions can be integrated with other platform features, such as search and booking tools. This can allow users to seamlessly move between different parts of the platform without having to leave the chat window.

4. Multilingual support: Chat functions can be programmed to support multiple languages, which can be especially helpful for users who are traveling to destinations where they may not be familiar with the local language.

5. 24/7 availability: Chat functions can provide users with round-the-clock support, which can be especially important for users who are booking travel outside of traditional business hours.

In terms of user interface design, chat functions should be prominently displayed on the screen and easily accessible from any page within the platform. The chat window should be designed to look and feel like a messaging app, with text bubbles for messages and avatars for users. The input field should be clearly visible and easy to access, allowing users to type in their questions and receive answers in real-time.

Overall, incorporating chat functions into the user interface of a trip booking platform can provide a more personalized and intuitive experience for users. By incorporating NLP technology, personalization, integration with other platform features, multilingual support, and 24/7 availability, trip booking platforms can provide users with a more engaging and efficient experience.

title: Frontend Development Engineer Essentials to Learn
description: My journey on learning web development

body.raw:
---

# I have decided to become a web developer in Japan. 

I came to Japan to study for my Master Degree at Nagoya University. This was right after the pandemic and Japan opened its border for brief period which gave me a window to come here. I was thrilled to start a new journey and life has turned to be even better for me and wife.
As I mentioned in my about section, I am a recent dad of a wonderful boy. Since I heard the news, I have decided to support my family by working here. Well, this is not an easy experience with little Japanese, and with travel tourism background.
I taught english to kindergarten kids and in the spare time started learning web development since I had UI UX designer skills. Well, after maybe 100 applications, I was able to join a system development team.
I am writing about things I have researched about on becoming frontend engineer in this post. You might find it silly or funny but this experience has taught me a lot about web development. I am still constantly learning about new technologies and tools to improve myself to be better developer.

 Here are some of the key essentials for frontend development engineers to learn:

1. HTML/CSS: HTML is the markup language used to structure content on the web, while CSS is used to style it. These are the building blocks of every website and application and are essential for any frontend development engineer to learn.

2. JavaScript: JavaScript is the programming language of the web and is used to make websites interactive and dynamic. It's an essential skill for frontend developers as it enables them to create rich, engaging user experiences.

3. Frontend Frameworks: Frontend frameworks such as React, Angular, and Vue are essential tools for modern frontend development. They allow developers to create complex web applications more efficiently by providing pre-built components and a structure for organizing code.

4. Responsive Design: With the rise of mobile devices, responsive design has become essential for frontend developers. This means designing websites that adapt to different screen sizes and devices, providing a seamless user experience across all platforms.

5. Web Performance: In today's fast-paced digital world, users expect websites and applications to load quickly. Frontend developers need to understand web performance optimization techniques such as lazy loading, code splitting, and caching to ensure their applications are fast and responsive.

6. Version Control: Version control is essential for any software development project, including frontend development. It allows developers to track changes to their code, collaborate with others, and roll back changes if necessary. Git is the most popular version control system, and it's essential for frontend developers to learn.

7. Testing: Testing is an essential part of any software development project, and frontend development is no exception. Frontend developers should be familiar with testing frameworks such as Jest, Enzyme, and Cypress to ensure their applications are free of bugs and perform as expected.

8. Accessibility: Accessibility is an essential consideration for frontend developers. Websites and applications should be designed and developed with accessibility in mind, ensuring they are usable by everyone, including people with disabilities.

I hope this will help you as it helped me during my developer experience.
